security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and methodology for systematic debugging. No network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Find root causes before fixing bugs
content.value_statement: Bug fixes often fail when they only address symptoms. This four-phase debugging framework ensures you understand the root cause before attempting solutions. Reduces debugging time and prevents recurring issues.
actual_capabilities: Four-phase debugging framework (investigation, pattern analysis, hypothesis testing, implementation)
Root cause identification before attempting fixes
Failure recovery with 3-attempt limit before architectural review
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Does not access external debugging tools or debuggers
Does not provide real-time error monitoring
Requires manual evidence collection by the user

use_cases.title: Debug Production Issues
use_cases.description: Systematically diagnose bugs in production or development environments using root cause analysis

use_cases.title: Investigate Test Failures
use_cases.description: Analyze test failures to determine whether they indicate real bugs or test issues

use_cases.title: Debug Deployment Failures
use_cases.description: Trace deployment failures through multi-component system diagnosis

prompt_templates.title: Quick Bug Report
prompt_templates.prompt: I found a bug: [describe the issue]. Use the systematic debugging framework to help me find the root cause.

prompt_templates.title: Test Failure
prompt_templates.prompt: My test [test name] is failing with error: [error message]. Follow Phase 1 investigation steps to help me understand what is happening.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a complex issue affecting [system components]. Use the full systematic debugging framework to trace the data flow and find root causes.

prompt_templates.title: Prevention Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: We found the root cause: [cause]. Help me write a failing test case and implement a fix following Phase 4 guidelines.

output_examples.input: My API returns 500 errors for user ID 12345 but works for other users
output: - Recent changes: [check git log for relevant commits]
- Data flow: User 12345 ‚Üí API ‚Üí [trace each component]
- Working case: User ID 12346 works correctly
1. User 12345 has corrupted data ‚Üí Check database
2. Missing permission for specific user ‚Üí Check ACL
Test each hypothesis one at a time...

best_practices: Always reproduce the issue consistently before attempting fixes
Change only one variable at a time when testing hypotheses
Document evidence, attempts, and results for future reference
anti_patterns: Applying quick fixes without understanding root cause
Skipping the investigation phases and guessing

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses Read, Glob, Grep, Bash, and Edit tools for investigation.

faq.question: How long does systematic debugging take?
faq.answer: First application may take 15-30 minutes. Practice reduces future debugging time significantly.

faq.question: Can I skip phases if I am confident?
faq.answer: No. Skipping phases often leads to symptom fixes that fail. The framework exists to prevent this.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no external network access or data collection.

faq.question: What if three hypothesis tests fail?
faq.answer: Stop and escalate to architectural review. The issue may require design changes, not code fixes.

faq.question: How is this different from standard debugging?
faq.answer: Standard debugging often guesses. This framework enforces evidence-based root cause identification before any fix attempt.
